instructions: Combine garbanzo bean flour and tapioca starch in a bowl.
Add half of the water to the dry ingredients.
Stir mixture using chopsticks.
Let dough rest for a few minutes.
Add remaining water to the dough.
If dough is sticky, add more garbanzo bean flour.
Prepare a small bowl of salt.
Prepare a bowl of oil and a brush.
Dust counter and rolling pin with tapioca starch.
Divide dough into six equal portions.
Roll one portion of dough to 0.25 inch thickness.
Brush rolled dough with oil.
Sprinkle a small amount of salt on top.
Roll the dough like a taco.
Coil the rolled dough like a snail.
Roll the coiled dough again to 0.25 inch thickness.
Place flattened dough on plastic wrap.
Repeat rolling process for remaining portions.
Pour oil into a pan until it reaches about 0.125 inch depth.
Heat oil in pan.
Place one flatbread into hot oil.
Cook flatbread for a few minutes until golden on one side.
Turn flatbread carefully with tongs.
Cook until both sides are dark golden.
Remove flatbread from pan.
Place cooked flatbread on paper towel to drain oil.
Repeat frying with remaining dough pieces.
Serve warm with desired toppings.
Store leftovers in refrigerator.
Reheat leftovers by toasting or microwaving.
